page.title: 19PUBLIC TRANSPORT
page.content: THE BUS SERVICE IS THE ONLY MEANS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORT THERE IS FOR RODINGTON AND WITHINGTON. THE TWO NEAREST SHOPPING CENTRES ARE WELLINGTON AND SHREWSBURY. THERE IS A BUS TO SHREWSBURY ON WEDNESDAY MORNING RETURNING AFTER NOON. IT THEN RETURNS TO SHREWSBURY BUT ANY PASSENGERS HAVE TO ARRANGE THEIR OWN RETURN TRANSPORT. THE NEXT SERVICE TO SHREWSBURY IS ON SATURDAY, WHEN THERE IS A BUS BOTH MORNING AND AFTERNOON. THE BUS TO WELLINGTON IS ON A THURSDAY, WHICH IS MARKET DAY. THIS IS A MORNING SERVICE AND ANY PASSENGERS HAVE TO MAKE THEIR OWN WAY HOME IF THEY RETURN IN THE AFTERNOON. THE JOURNEY TAKES AN HOUR, STOPPING AT ALL THE PICK UP POINTS.THE BUS IS RARELY FILLED. MOST PEOPLE REGARD THIS AS AN ADEQUATE SERVICE. WHEN YOU LIVE IN THE COUNTRY YOU EXPECT TO PROVIDE YOUR OWN TRANSPORT.
